Job Title: Assistant Director of Communications - Arnhold Institute for Global Health & the Department of Global Health & Health System Design

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Description

The Assistant Director of Communications and Global Partnerships will play a critical role in ensuring the success of the Arnhold Institute for Global Health and the Department of Global Health and Health System Design programs. The Assistant Director will lead the development, implementation, and coordination of the Institute and Department’s communications strategies in partnership with Institute and Department leadership and Mount Sinai’s Communications, Marketing, and PR teams. They will be responsible for the successful and effective communication of our story to key supporters, sponsors, internal and external constituents, and major donors and other key supporters. Their efforts to tell AIGH’s story, strengthen recognition of the Institute and Department brand, and build the capacity of our global partners to engage in effective marketing and communications will play a major role in growing support for AIGH’s global health programs and partnerships. The Assistant Director will also lead the Institute and Department’s strategies to translate our global health research findings into more effective health policy and practice – helping to broaden the scale and impact of our faculty’s global health research efforts. These efforts are critical to the success of the Institute and Department’s Vision, Mission, and Strategic Goals.

Reporting to the Vice Chair of Operations, Department of Global Health & Health System Design & Director of Global Partnerships & Programs, Arnhold Institute for Global Health (AIGH), the Assistant Director will oversee the development and implementation of the Institute and Department’s communications strategy. They will supervise the Institute and Department’s communications team including the Communications Manager and external vendors for design and other services. They are responsible for managing all Institute and Department websites, social media accounts, blogs, and other media and will ensure all Institute and Department media are up-to-date. Their team will ensure effective internal and external communication, marketing, and brand compliance within the Institute and Department. The Assistant Director will represent the Institute and Department as our primary liaison with Mount Sinai’s marketing and communications team as well as external communications partners including partner communications team and PR leads, vendors, and other relevant stakeholders.

In addition, the Assistant Director will contribute to the Department and Institute’s fundraising strategy and engagement with philanthropic donors and other sponsors in coordination with Mount Sinai’s Development Office. This includes coordinating across our partnerships to identify and communicate funding priorities. They will oversee the development and administration of constituent management and communications systems to engage program participants, supporters, and potential donors and develop effective programs to communicate with donors and supporters.

They will play a lead role in supporting communications strategy for AIGH’s paid consultancies working with clients to identify, scope, and implement communications need. This will include developing and implementing national and international health communications strategies and campaigns, client capacity development, and resource development.

Responsibilities

Plans, directs, and coordinates Institute and Department communications strategies to ensure the success of the Institute and Department’s vision, mission, strategic goals, Partnerships, and programsServes as primary institute and department liaison to Mount Sinai’s branding, marketing, and communications teamsParticipates in leadership meetings with key stakeholders and program leadershipReviews Institute and Department cooperative agreements, work plans, budgets, performance monitoring plans, assessments, and other key strategy documents and advises executive program leadership on communications approaches and allotment of other resources needed for successful implementation of priority activitiesManages the Communications team to ensure the timely and effective implementation of Institute and Department programs and communications strategiesDevelops and manages Institute and Department communications assets including, but not limited to, websites, social media accounts, promotional materials, blogs, press releases, and other mediaIdentifies, and as applicable provides, appropriate guidance and training to Institute and Department teams including faculty, staff, and consultants to achieve program goalsEstablishes and develops partnerships with internal and external program stakeholders to support and facilitate the successful implementation of program communications objectivesProvides leadership to the Institute and Department communications team guiding program implementation, providing clarity on program priorities, policies and procedures, deliverables, and timelinesOversees the management and implementation of assigned Institute and/or Department budgets for communications Develops and presents program overviews, progress reports, and proposals to internal and external partners on behalf of Institute and Department leadership as neededMaintains effective and constructive communications with Institute and Department leadership and other key stakeholdersDevelops, implements, and evaluates communications strategies to support Institute and Department fund development strategies and goals including strategies to engage key constituentsEnsures all program personnel understand their responsibility to operate in accordance with the Institute and Department’s vision, mission, and values, standards for equity, and policies and procedures, and ensures all program personnel fulfill their individual responsibilities for upholding these values, standards, and policiesLeads the development and implementation of communications strategies for the Institute and Department including the development of program reports, marketing materials, and materials used for outreach and program implementationManages direct reports ensuring individual performance goals and responsibilities are met and provides mentorship, training, and support to ensure their successAdvises executive leadership on strategy, communications, fundraising, and other strategic considerations critical to achieving program objectivesTravels as needed to global partnership locations and domestic and international meetings and events to represent and support Institute and Department leadershipOther activities as assigned by the Vice Chair of Operations, Department of Global Health & Health System Design & Director of Global Partnerships & Programs, Arnhold Institute for Global Health (AIGH)

Qualifications

Bachelors Degree in Health Care Administration, Public Administration or related field; Masters Degree preferred.5 years minimum experience, preferably in a health care settingExcellent leadership, management, and communications skills, strong interpersonal skills, cross-cultural understanding, diplomacy and outreach skills to establish and maintain positive working relationships with internal and external partners, donors, and other stakeholdersStrong previous experience living in Low- and Middle-Income Countries (LMICs) and working on donor-funded health and development initiatives strongly preferred. A demonstrated track record of building and leading diverse, gender equitable teams in global health settings through leadership, recruitment, training, mentorship, and other activities to support and promote a diverse and equitable environment for faculty, staff, and students.Significant and recent experience in a leadership role on a program related to global healthAbility to work with a wide-range of constituents in the international, academic, for-profit, governmental and non-profit sectorsSuperior ability to understand, interpret, and communicate Department & Institute, Mount Sinai, and sponsor rules and regulations Exceptional presentation skills including experience presenting to senior organizational leaders, policy makers, and board and trustee membersHigh level experience leading collaborative decision making and consensus building processes for international organizations and networksExperience managing external communications about program performance and impact including expert knowledge of website content management, e-mail marketing and communications systems, social media platforms, and web based constituent management systems

Employer Description

Strength Through Diversity

The Mount Sinai Health System believes that diversity, equity, and inclusion are key drivers for excellence. We share a common devotion to delivering exceptional patient care. When you join us, you become a part of Mount Sinai’s unrivaled record of achievement, education, and advancement as we revolutionize medicine together. We invite you to participate actively as a part of the Mount Sinai Health System team by:

Using a lens of equity in all aspects of patient care delivery, education, and research to promote policies and practices to allow opportunities for all to thrive and reach their potential.Serving as a role model confronting racist, sexist, or other inappropriate actions by speaking up, challenging exclusionary organizational practices, and standing side-by-side in support of colleagues who experience discrimination.Inspiring and fostering an environment of anti-racist behaviors among and between departments and co-workers.

We work hard to acquire and retain the best people and to create an inclusive, welcoming and nurturing work environment where all feel they are valued, belong and are able to professional advance. We share the belief that all employees, regardless of job title or expertise contribute to the patient experience and quality of patient care.

Explore more about this opportunity and how you can help us write a new chapter in our history!

“About the Mount Sinai Health System:

Mount Sinai Health System is one of the largest academic medical systems in the New York metro area, with more than 43,000 employees working across eight hospitals, more than 400 outpatient practices, more than 300 labs, a school of nursing, and a leading school of medicine and graduate education. Mount Sinai advances health for all people, everywhere, by taking on the most complex health care challenges of our time — discovering and applying new scientific learning and knowledge; developing safer, more effective treatments; educating the next generation of medical leaders and innovators; and supporting local communities by delivering high-quality care to all who need it. Through the integration of its hospitals, labs, and schools, Mount Sinai offers comprehensive health care solutions from birth through geriatrics, leveraging innovative approaches such as artificial intelligence and informatics while keeping patients’ medical and emotional needs at the center of all treatment. The Health System includes approximately 7,400 primary and specialty care physicians; 13 joint-venture outpatient surgery centers throughout the five boroughs of New York City, Westchester, Long Island, and Florida; and more than 30 affiliated community health centers. We are consistently ranked by U.S. News & World Report's Best Hospitals, receiving high "Honor Roll" status, and are highly ranked: No. 1 in Geriatrics and top 20 in Cardiology/Heart Surgery, Diabetes/Endocrinology, Gastroenterology/GI Surgery, Neurology/Neurosurgery, Orthopedics, Pulmonology/Lung Surgery, Rehabilitation, and Urology. New York Eye and Ear Infirmary of Mount Sinai is ranked No. 12 in Ophthalmology. U.S. News & World Report’s “Best Children’s Hospitals” ranks Mount Sinai Kravis Children's Hospital among the country’s best in several pediatric specialties. The Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai is ranked No. 14 nationwide in National Institutes of Health funding and in the 99th percentile in research dollars per investigator according to the Association of American Medical Colleges. Newsweek’s “The World’s Best Smart Hospitals” ranks The Mount Sinai Hospital as No. 1 in New York and in the top five globally, and Mount Sinai Morningside in the top 20 globally.

The Mount Sinai Health System is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with applicable Federal civil rights laws and does not discriminate, exclude, or treat people differently on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are passionately committed to addressing racism and its effects on our faculty, staff, students, trainees, patients, visitors, and the communities we serve. Our goal is for Mount Sinai to become an anti-racist health care and learning institution that intentionally addresses structural racism.”

EOE Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans

Compensation

The Mount Sinai Health System (MSHS) provides a salary range to comply with the New York City Law on Salary Transparency in Job Advertisements. The salary range for the role is $78884 - $153057.94 Annually. Actual salaries depend on a variety of factors, including experience, education, and hospital need. The salary range or contractual rate listed does not include bonuses/incentive, differential pay or other forms of compensation or benefits.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
